attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 7 March 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (-20 loaves)

Ø  Utto- (-2.6 kg)

Ø  Cumulative shortfall in polybags-    173 pieces

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Good inventory controls should be maintained

value: No significant stock variances was noted in the previous audit findings.
Stock controls are effective as no material variance was noted in the inventory items.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.

Implication

·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.

value: No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread weight Check
attributes.description:
·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        Both sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 09% and 400g W- 05%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.

value: Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.
Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are observed.

attributes.title: Bread Damages
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of bread damages from 03.02.25 – 06.03.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 935 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.23% of the total loaves produced.

·        981 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.20% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        The effective controls should be maintained.

value: Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.
·        Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 04.02.25 – 06.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        Physical and system material usage was matching

·        No variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.
Production standards were observed.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The branch hired a total of 453 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,039 bags.

·        The actual production was 1,996 bags leading to a production shortfall of 43 bags.

·        The actual efficiency was 4.4 bags per person which is below the set limit.

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to improve on the planning of production  workers to ensure that the set efficiencies are achieved.

value: The drop in efficiency was contributed by frequent shift-cuts to control bread balance
Both production and packaging efficiencies were not achieved in the previous audit findings.
Production efficiency was not achieved indicating that the company incurred high production cost.

attributes.title: Packaging efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 30,038 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 310 workers.

·        A total of 318 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 94.5 crates per worker.

·        Extra 8 packers were hired over the audit period and the set packaging efficiency was not achieved.
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to improve on the planning of packaging workers to ensure that the set efficiency is achieved.

value: Both production and packaging efficiencies were not achieved in the previous audit findings.
The set packaging efficiency was not achieved indicating that the company incurred high packaging cost.

attributes.title: Generator fuel usage analysis
attributes.description:
·       Review of generator records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.

·        Comparison of physical records and system records was done to ensure accurate readings are maintained.

·        No significant variation between physical records and the system records.

·        The average fuel consumption rate was 22.75 litres per hour which is within the range.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to ensure that proper controls are always adhered.

value: The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 31.0 L/Hr.
Generator fuel is well controlled
